messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling books, was Jumping right	in...
messages.msgSnippet: ... I enjoyed Family Matters: Why Homeschooling Makes Sense by David Gutterson, and I recall someone commenting here a while back that it seemed to go over
messages.messageBody:
> I am wondering if anyone knows of a good "one stop shopping"
> resource for him to get a clearer picture of what we are about to embark
> on.

I enjoyed Family Matters: Why Homeschooling Makes Sense by David Gutterson,
and I recall someone commenting here a while back that it seemed to go over
well with the guys.

If you are Christian, I can say that Christian Unschooling by Teri Brown has
been the shortest introduction to unschooling I've ever read, and I've
really liked it. It's very short and to the point.

I'll be happy to wave Sandra's flag for her, and tell you that I found her
website very useful (www.SandraDodd.com/unschooling).

Have a great time this year. It's exciting!

brenda
